page.title: 18HOMEWATCH ADLINGTON.
page.content: The Homewatch Community Security Scheme was instigated by the Parish Council in Adlington in Feb. 1985. This voluntary self-help scheme involves the local community & the police co-operating together with a common aim, that of reducing crime particularly burglary in Adlington. The village is divided into groups with about ten households per group. In each group one selected representative acts as co-ordinator. The main functions are the observation of suspicious persons or vehicles in the neighbourhood, watching neighbour's homes when unoccupied & reporting anything suspicious to the co-ordinator who in turn notifies the police. Records show that in areas where "Homewatch" is in operation the crime rate is substantially reduced.
